page.title: 07 A Farm in Wilby
page.content: The farm we visited in Wilby is situated just off the main road. It is a small farm of only 600 acres which is worked by the farmer & two other men. It has four tractors and a combine harvester which are kept in the farm buidings close to home.Although the farm is mainly arable it does have 100 cattle which are reared for beef and a few hens which lay 30 to 40 eggs each week. The main crops this year are rape, kale,potatoes,peas and corn. The farmer's year begins in autumn with ploughing,drilling and the sowing of seeds.In winter when the ground is hard,the workers attend to the ditches and fences which have to be repaired. In spring the young plants have to be sprayed to stop pests and diseases. Summer is a busy time with the harvesting of crops before the year begins again in the autumn.
